item.title: Drug Resistant TB Is Predicted To Steadily Spread In 4 Countries
item.description: May 9, 2017 - The case numbers are already high in certain countries. It's not only hard to treat — it's extremely contagious.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - The case numbers are already high in certain countries. It's not only hard to treat — it's extremely contagious. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/09/527631455/drug-resistant-tb-is-predicted-to-steadily-spread-in-4-countries

item.title: Fact-Checking Republicans' Defense Of The GOP Health Bill
item.description: May 9, 2017 - In TV appearances and meetings with constituents, House Republicans are highlighting parts of the law that protect consumers, while glossing over loopholes that allow insurers to avoid paying.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - In TV appearances and meetings with constituents, House Republicans are highlighting parts of the law that protect consumers, while glossing over loopholes that allow insurers to avoid paying. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/09/527627331/fact-checking-republicans-defense-of-the-gop-health-bill

item.title: Colorado Governor On Republican Health Care Bill: This Is Not An Improvement
item.description: May 9, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper about health care reform. Colorado expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act and would either have to take on that funding burden or change eligibility requirements under the American Health Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper about health care reform. Colorado expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act and would either have to take on that funding burden or change eligibility requirements under the American Health Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/09/527640423/colorado-governor-on-republican-health-care-bill-this-is-not-an-improvement

item.title: The Global Gap In Health Care Dollars For Young And Old Is Huge
item.description:
May 9, 2017 - The U.S. has one kind of gap. The developing world has another, as a new report points out.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/09/527453473/old-people-get-very-little-health-care-in-the-developing-world
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - The U.S. has one kind of gap. The developing world has another, as a new report points out. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/09/527453473/old-people-get-very-little-health-care-in-the-developing-world

item.title: One-Third Of New Drugs Had Safety Problems After FDA Approval
item.description: May 9, 2017 - More than 70 drugs approved by the FDA from 2001 to 2010 ran into safety concerns that prompted withdrawals from the market, "black box" warnings or other actions.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - More than 70 drugs approved by the FDA from 2001 to 2010 ran into safety concerns that prompted withdrawals from the market, "black box" warnings or other actions. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/09/527575055/one-third-of-new-drugs-had-safety-problems-after-fda-approval

item.title: Don't Screen For Thyroid Cancer, Task Force Says
item.description: May 9, 2017 - A federal task force says the risks of screening outweigh benefits. Many thyroid growths never develop into dangerous cancers, and overdiagnosis can lead people to have unnecessary surgery.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - A federal task force says the risks of screening outweigh benefits. Many thyroid growths never develop into dangerous cancers, and overdiagnosis can lead people to have unnecessary surgery. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/09/527569291/dont-screen-for-thyroid-cancer-task-force-says

item.title: New Businesses Give Restaurant Workers The Tips They Ache For: Wellness
item.description: May 9, 2017 - Waiting, cooking and tending bar can take a heavy toll on the body and mind. Several health-minded support services are springing up to help workers stay in the game for the long term.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - Waiting, cooking and tending bar can take a heavy toll on the body and mind. Several health-minded support services are springing up to help workers stay in the game for the long term. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/09/524398689/new-businesses-give-restaurant-workers-the-tips-they-ache-for-wellness

item.title: Medicare Didn't Investigate Suspicious Reports Of Hospital Infections
item.description: May 9, 2017 - The inspector general at Health and Human Services says Medicare should have done an in-depth review of suspicious reports from hospitals to keep them from covering up problems with infections.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - The inspector general at Health and Human Services says Medicare should have done an in-depth review of suspicious reports from hospitals to keep them from covering up problems with infections. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/09/527432852/medicare-didnt-investigate-suspicious-reports-of-hospital-infections

item.title: GOP Health Bill Leaves Many 'Pre-Existing Condition' Protections Up To States
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Before the Affordable Care Act, people with pre-existing conditions often couldn't get health insurance — or paid sky-high premiums. The bill passed by the House last week would let states decide.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - Before the Affordable Care Act, people with pre-existing conditions often couldn't get health insurance — or paid sky-high premiums. The bill passed by the House last week would let states decide. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/08/527415655/gop-health-bill-leaves-many-pre-existing-condition-protections-up-to-states

item.title: Is A Stradivarius Violin Easier To Hear? Science Says Nope
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Old Italian violins like those made by Stradivari are famous for their ability to project their sound. But a study found people in a blind test thought new violins projected better than old ones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - Old Italian violins like those made by Stradivari are famous for their ability to project their sound. But a study found people in a blind test thought new violins projected better than old ones. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/08/527057108/is-a-stradivarius-violin-easier-to-hear-science-says-nope

item.title: Trump's Budget Would Eliminate A Key Funder Of Research On Coastal Pollution
item.description: May 8, 2017 - The Sea Grant program, which funds research on coastal environments, is slated by White House for elimination in 2018. If it goes, a project that finds leaking septic tanks goes down the drain, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - The Sea Grant program, which funds research on coastal environments, is slated by White House for elimination in 2018. If it goes, a project that finds leaking septic tanks goes down the drain, too. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/08/527095737/trumps-budget-would-eliminate-a-key-funder-of-research-on-coastal-pollution

item.title: Public Restrooms Become Ground Zero In The Opioid Epidemic
item.description: May 8, 2017 - People often turn to public restrooms as a place to get high on opioids. It has led some establishments to close their facilities, while others are training employees to help people who overdose.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - People often turn to public restrooms as a place to get high on opioids. It has led some establishments to close their facilities, while others are training employees to help people who overdose. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/08/526523520/public-restrooms-become-ground-zero-in-the-opioid-epidemic

item.title: Life Expectancy Can Vary By 20 Years Depending On Where You Live
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Geographic inequality in life span is growing in the United States, with people in some counties living more than 20 years longer than those in others.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - Geographic inequality in life span is growing in the United States, with people in some counties living more than 20 years longer than those in others. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/08/527103885/life-expectancy-can-vary-by-20-years-depending-on-where-you-live

item.title: Obama Calls On Congress To Have 'Courage' On Health Care
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Receiving the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award for his own work on health care, the former president said, "It actually doesn't take a lot of courage to aid those who are already powerful."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - Receiving the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award for his own work on health care, the former president said, "It actually doesn't take a lot of courage to aid those who are already powerful." http://www.npr.org/2017/05/08/527378943/obama-calls-on-congress-to-have-courage-on-health-care

item.title: Fresh Food By Prescription: This Health Care Firm Is Trimming Costs — And Waistlines
item.description: May 8, 2017 - The rising prevalence and cost of Type 2 diabetes has doctors at Geisinger Health System turning to food as a form of medicine. They're prescribing free, fresh food to low-income patients.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - The rising prevalence and cost of Type 2 diabetes has doctors at Geisinger Health System turning to food as a form of medicine. They're prescribing free, fresh food to low-income patients. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/08/526952657/fresh-food-by-prescription-this-health-care-firm-is-trimming-costs-and-waistline
